COHORT.EMPTY: You have not defined a cohort yet. Upload an existing cohort selection or create a new one.
COHORT.REQUIRED: Cohort selection is a mandatory field

EDITOR.EMPTY: You have not defined a feature selection yet. Upload an existing feature selection or create a new one.

ERROR.DOWNLOAD: No cohort defined; download not possible
ERROR.UPLOAD: No valid cohort defined in the uploaded file

EDITOR.HEADER_DESCRIPTION: Define which patient features in the cohort are relevant to your research question here. Pay attention to data sparseness and alignment with your study protocol, ethics approval, or research proposal (if available). Change the selection by clicking the pencil icon and add filters (e.g., specific diagnosis codes) as needed.
EDITOR.HEADER_INFO1: For your research question, you can now define which data you would like to receive from the patients in the cohort. We recommend booking a consultation at the FDPG for feature selection and carrying out the feature selection together with the support of FDPG staff. To do so, please register at
EDITOR.HEADER_INFO2: . There are two tutorials on how to use the system on the FDPG website:
EDITOR.HEADER_INFO3: When editing, please note that all intermediate results must be saved by clicking on "Save" in the module editing view.

SEARCH.HEADER_INFO1: For your research question, you can now define which data you would like to receive from the patients in the cohort. We recommend booking a consultation at the FDPG for feature selection and carrying out the feature selection together with the support of FDPG staff. To do so, please register at
SEARCH.HEADER_INFO2: . There are two tutorials on how to use the system on the FDPG website:
SEARCH.HEADER_INFO3: When editing, please note that all intermediate results must be saved by clicking on "Save" in the module editing view.
SEARCH.INFOTEXT: Select criteria to study and download your data definition. You can upload the data selection file as an attachment to your research proposal in the proposal portal.

REFERENCE.INFO: Click on 'Add new reference' to create a new reference

ERROR.FEAS-10001: Your account has been locked due to too many queries. Please contact info@research-for-health.de
ERROR.FEAS-10002: You have made too many queries. Please wait and try again.
ERROR.FEAS-10003: You have made too many queries. Please wait and try again.
ERROR.FEAS-10004: The result set is too small; results will not be displayed.
ERROR.FEAS-10005: The number of responding locations is too small; detailed results will not be displayed.
ERROR.FEAS-10006: You have saved too many cohorts. Please delete some cohort selections before saving more.
ERROR.VAL-20001: The combination of context and term code(s) was not found.

CONSENT.EU_GDPR: All data recipients in countries with data protection compliant with EU GDPR
CONSENT.NON_EU_GDPR: Data recipients abroad with data protection lower than EU GDPR

EDITOR.EMPTY: Sorry, we could not find any results for
EDITOR.HEADER_INFO: Edit your criteria here and compile your cohort selection. The cohort selection can be used to directly submit a cross-location feasibility query.

HINT.MAXIMUM_EXCEEDED: Value must be at most {{ max }}
HINT.MINIMUM_EXCEEDED: Value must be at least {{ min }}
HINT.MINIMUM_GREATER_MAXIMUM: The minimum value must be less than the maximum value
HINT.NO_CRITERIA_SELECTED: At least one inclusion criterion must be selected
HINT.SEARCH_TEXT_NO_INPUT: Enter a search criterion or open the category overview

RESULT.DETAILS_TOOLTIP: Shows how many detailed result calls you have used â€” resets daily
RESULT.HEADER_DESCRIPTION: The number of patients meeting your cohort criteria is determined across locations. This result is approximate.
RESULT.MESSAGE429: You have reached the maximum number of calls for location breakdown.
RESULT.PATIENT_NUMBER_TOOLTIP: Feasibility queries return approximate, anonymized results with deliberate deviations from exact numbers. Use these results only for initial project feasibility assessment. They are not suitable for scientific work. Publishing these numbers is generally prohibited. The actual patient count can only be determined via a formal data usage request reviewed by responsible Use & Access Committees.

SAVE_DIALOG.HEADER_DESCRIPTION: The number of patients meeting your cohort criteria is determined across locations. This result is approximate.

SEARCH.EMPTY: Sorry, we could not find any results for
SEARCH.HEADER_INFO: Define your cohort based on criteria selectable via the search field. For targeted searches, restrict by terminology (e.g., ICD10, LOINC, OPS) or CDS modules. Use the cohort selection to estimate patient counts nationwide.
SEARCH.LABEL: Enter code or search term
SEARCH.SEARCHBAR: Search for term or terminology code

ADDED_CRITERIA.PLURAL: You have added {{amount}} criteria to the cohort selection
ADDED_CRITERIA.SINGULAR: You have added {{amount}} criterion to the cohort selection

DELETE_MODAL.TITLE: Do you really want to delete the data query?

TIMERESTRICTION.TITLE: Time period (optional)
